Package Controller

Class AddAppointment_Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.AddAppointment_Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddAppointment_Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    A controller class for the Add Appointment form. Allows a user to add a new appointment to the database.

      • onActionClearForm

        void onActionClearForm​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Clears all of the data from the form so the user can start over.
        Parameters:
        event - The CLEAR ALL button is clicked.

      • onActionAddAppointment

        void onActionAddAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a new appointment to the database. Checks to make sure fields are not blank, the appointment is scheduled within business hours, the customer doesn't have overlapping appointments, and that the end time is after the start time. Displays an error message for each condition that needs to be fixed.
        Parameters:
        event - The Save button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onActionCancel

        void onActionCancel​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Cancels the addition of an appointment to the database. Displays an alert to confirm cancellation so that data is not accidentally lost.
        Parameters:
        event - The Cancel button is clicked.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        LAMBDA EXPRESSION USAGE to initialize the Add Appointment form. The lambda expression is used to set the items in the five combo boxes on the Add Appointment form. The lambda expression simplifies the redundant lines of code. Instead of writing the setItems and setPromptText functions 5 different times, you only need to write them one time and then use the lambda to put the combos, lists to fill them, and prompts all on one line.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        resourceBundle -
